filmography.title: The Man Who Played God
filmography.role_description: A loyal young woman who stands by a famous musician after he loses his hearing; the role that convinced Warner Bros. to keep Davis under contract.
filmography.plot: A deaf musician learns to read lips and uses his new skill to help others, while a young woman remains devoted to him.

filmography.title: Of Human Bondage
filmography.role_description: A vulgar, manipulative, and cruel Cockney waitress who abuses the devotion of a club-footed medical student.
filmography.plot: A young medical student falls obsessively in love with a callous waitress who repeatedly rejects and uses him.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Write-in Nomination – Best Actress (Unofficial but historically recognized)

filmography.title: Dangerous
filmography.role_description: A self-destructive, alcoholic former stage star who acts as a 'jinx' to the men who try to help her.
filmography.plot: A prominent architect risks his career and engagement to rehabilitate a washed-up, jinxed actress he idolizes.

filmography.title: The Petrified Forest
filmography.role_description: A dreamy, artistic waitress working in a desolate Arizona diner who yearns to escape to France to study art.
filmography.plot: A drifting intellectual and a gangster on the run cross paths at a lonely diner in the Arizona desert.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Marked Woman
filmography.role_description: A cynical nightclub hostess who courageously testifies against a powerful mob boss after he scars her sister.
filmography.plot: A district attorney persuades a nightclub hostess to testify against her gangster boss after a tragedy strikes her family.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup (Best Actress)

filmography.title: Kid Galahad
filmography.role_description: The mistress of a boxing promoter who falls for the naive young prizefighter she is helping to manage.
filmography.plot: A boxing promoter discovers a bellhop with a knockout punch and grooms him for the championship, causing conflict with his girlfriend and a rival gangster.

filmography.title: Jezebel
filmography.role_description: A headstrong, spoiled Southern belle in antebellum New Orleans whose scandalous behavior costs her the man she loves.
filmography.plot: A willful Southern belle defies societal rules and loses her fiancé, only to try and redeem herself when a yellow fever epidemic strikes.

filmography.title: Dark Victory
filmography.role_description: A hedonistic socialite who discovers she has a brain tumor and eventually finds peace and dignity in facing her mortality.
filmography.plot: A young socialite is diagnosed with a terminal illness and must choose whether to spend her final days partying or finding true happiness.

filmography.title: Juarez
filmography.role_description: The tragic Empress of Mexico who descends into madness as her husband's puppet empire collapses.
filmography.plot: Mexican President Benito Juarez fights the French occupation and the puppet Emperor Maximilian.

filmography.title: The Old Maid
filmography.role_description: A woman who allows her cousin to raise her illegitimate daughter, living as the 'old maid' aunt to be near her child.
filmography.plot: An unwed mother gives up her child to her cousin to raise, leading to a lifetime of jealousy and resentment.

filmography.title: The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex
filmography.role_description: The aging, powerful Queen of England who is torn between her love for the Earl of Essex and her duty to the throne.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the volatile relationship between Queen Elizabeth I and the Earl of Essex.

filmography.title: All This, and Heaven Too
filmography.role_description: A French governess who becomes the center of a scandalous murder trial involving a Duke and his jealous wife.
filmography.plot: A governess is accused of having an affair with a French Duke and inciting him to murder his wife.

filmography.title: The Letter
filmography.role_description: The wife of a rubber plantation administrator who kills a man and claims self-defense, concealing a cold-blooded secret.
filmography.plot: A woman claims she shot a man in self-defense, but an incriminating letter reveals she had been having an affair with him.

filmography.title: The Great Lie
filmography.role_description: A woman who makes a deal with her rival to raise the other woman's baby as her own to protect her husband's memory.
filmography.plot: A woman keeps her marriage a secret and later adopts the baby of her husband's former lover after he goes missing.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Mary Astor)

filmography.title: The Bride Came C.O.D.
filmography.role_description: A headstrong oil heiress who is kidnapped by a pilot hired by her father to stop her elopement.
filmography.plot: A pilot agrees to help a father stop his daughter's wedding by kidnapping her, but they crash in the desert and fall in love.

filmography.title: The Little Foxes
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, icy Southern matriarch who battles her equally greedy brothers for wealth and control, even at the cost of her husband's life.
filmography.plot: The ruthless, money-hungry Hubbard siblings scheme to outwit each other and secure a family fortune in the turn-of-the-century South.

filmography.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
filmography.role_description: The efficient, long-suffering secretary to an unbearable radio personality who finds romance in a small Ohio town.
filmography.plot: When a caustic radio critic breaks his hip in a small-town home, he takes over the household and meddles in everyone's lives.

filmography.title: In This Our Life
filmography.role_description: A selfish, destructive woman who steals her sister's husband and causes tragedy for everyone around her.
filmography.plot: A neurotic woman ruins her sister's life by running off with her husband and then tries to pin a hit-and-run accident on a young black man.

filmography.title: Now, Voyager
filmography.role_description: A repressed, dowdy spinster dominated by her mother who transforms into a sophisticated, independent woman through therapy and love.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist helps a repressed woman blossom into an independent beauty, but her new life is complicated by a doomed romance.

filmography.title: Watch on the Rhine
filmography.role_description: The devoted American wife of a German anti-fascist leader who returns home to Washington D.C. to find danger following them.
filmography.plot: A German family fleeing the Nazis seeks refuge in the United States, but their past threatens to catch up with them.

filmography.title: Old Acquaintance
filmography.role_description: A serious author who maintains a decades-long, turbulent friendship with a jealous and melodramatic rival writer.
filmography.plot: Two friends who are both writers envy each other's success and struggle with their complicated relationship over two decades.

filmography.title: Mr. Skeffington
filmography.role_description: A vain and popular beauty who marries a Jewish stockbroker for his money to save her brother, only realizing his true worth after her beauty fades.
filmography.plot: A spoiled beauty marries a rich man she doesn't love to save her brother from embezzlement charges, spanning decades of a loveless marriage.

filmography.title: The Corn Is Green
filmography.role_description: A dedicated schoolteacher who sets up a school in a Welsh mining village and mentors a gifted young miner.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher in a Welsh mining town discovers a young man with a brilliant mind and fights to give him an education.

filmography.title: A Stolen Life
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing twin sisters—one good, one bad—who vie for the love of the same man, leading to a tragic identity switch.
filmography.plot: A twin sister assumes the identity of her deceased sibling to win back the man she loves.

filmography.title: Deception
filmography.role_description: A pianist who is tormented by her former lover, a wealthy composer, after she marries a cellist.
filmography.plot: A music teacher marries her cellist lover after thinking her former lover, a famous composer, was dead, but the composer returns.

filmography.title: June Bride
filmography.role_description: A sharp-witted magazine editor who must work with her ex-boyfriend to cover a winter wedding in Indiana.
filmography.plot: A magazine editor and her former flame cover a 'typical American wedding' in winter, but complications ensue.

filmography.title: Beyond the Forest
filmography.role_description: A bored, evil housewife who will stop at nothing, including murder, to escape her small town; famous for the line 'What a dump!'
filmography.plot: A murderous, adulterous housewife tries to leave her small-town doctor husband for a wealthy industrialist.

filmography.title: All About Eve
filmography.role_description: A highly regarded but aging Broadway star who becomes the target of a ruthless, manipulative fan insinuating herself into her life.
filmography.plot: A seemingly timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the life of an aging Broadway star, ultimately threatening her career and personal relationships.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Cannes: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: The Star
filmography.role_description: A washed-up, former Oscar-winning actress who cannot accept that her stardom has faded and desperately tries to force a comeback.
filmography.plot: A fading movie queen, broke and unable to face reality, tries to restart her career while a former actor tries to save her from herself.

filmography.title: The Virgin Queen
filmography.role_description: Reprising her role as the English monarch, she plays an older Elizabeth who faces the ambitions of Sir Walter Raleigh.
filmography.plot: Sir Walter Raleigh attempts to gain the favor of Queen Elizabeth I to secure ships for the New World.

filmography.title: The Catered Affair
filmography.role_description: A Bronx housewife who insists on giving her daughter a lavish wedding despite the family's financial struggles.
filmography.plot: A working-class mother fights to give her daughter an expensive wedding, causing tension with her husband and the couple.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Debbie Reynolds)

filmography.title: Pocketful of Miracles
filmography.role_description: A gin-soaked street peddler who poses as a wealthy society matron to impress her visiting daughter.
filmography.plot: A gangster helps an apple seller impersonate a wealthy woman so her daughter can marry a Spanish count.

filmography.title: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
filmography.role_description: A grotesque, mentally unstable former child star who torments her paraplegic sister in their decaying Hollywood mansion.
filmography.plot: A former child star torments her paraplegic sister in their decaying Hollywood mansion.

filmography.title: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
filmography.role_description: A reclusive Southern spinster haunted by the memory of her lover's murder decades earlier, fighting to keep her crumbling estate.
filmography.plot: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness when her cousin arrives to save the family estate.

filmography.title: The Nanny
filmography.role_description: A devoted English nanny who hides a dark and murderous secret regarding the death of a child in her care.
filmography.plot: A young boy is accused of killing his sister, but he insists that his loving nanny is actually the one responsible.

filmography.title: Death on the Nile
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, kleptomaniac socialite traveling on a Nile steamer who becomes a suspect in a murder investigation.
filmography.plot: As Hercule Poirot enjoys a luxurious cruise down the Nile, a newlywed heiress is found murdered on board.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Angela Lansbury)

filmography.title: The Whales of August
filmography.role_description: A blind, bitter, and cynical elderly woman who is cared for by her sweeter sister during a summer on an island in Maine.
filmography.plot: Two elderly sisters, one blind and bitter, the other sweet and patient, reflect on their lives and possible futures while vacationing in Maine.
